note.para: It is highly recommended to perform a test update on a separate testing machine first.

varlistentry.term: Upgrading from an earlier version of OTRS 6

listitem.para: You can upgrade directly from any previous to the latest available patch level release.
You can upgrade from any OTRS 5 patch level to the latest available OTRS 6 patch level release.

warning.para: You cannot upgrade from OTRS 4 or earlier directly to OTRS 6. Instead, full updates to all available minor versions have to be made sequentially instead. For example, if you come from OTRS 3.0, you first have to perform a full update to OTRS 3.1, then to 3.2, 3.3, 4, 5 and finally to OTRS 6.

section.title: Step 1: Stop all relevant services and the OTRS Daemon
section.para: Please make sure there are no more running services or cron jobs that try to access OTRS. This will depend on your service configuration, here is an example:

para.screen: root> /etc/init.d/cron stop root> /etc/init.d/postfix stop root> /etc/init.d/apache stop

section.para: Stop OTRS cron jobs and the daemon (in this order):

para.screen: otrs> cd /opt/otrs/ otrs> bin/Cron.sh stop otrs> bin/otrs.Daemon.pl stop

warning.para: Don't proceed without a complete backup of your system.

section.title: Step 3: Install the new release (tar or RPM)
Step 3.1: With the tarball:
section.screen: root> cd /opt root> mv otrs otrs-old root> tar -xzf otrs-x.x.x.tar.gz root> mv otrs-x.x.x otrs

section.title: Restore article data
section.para: If you configured OTRS to store article data in the filesystem you have to restore the article folder to /opt/otrs/var/ or the folder specified in the SysConfig.

section.title: Restore already installed default statistics
section.para: If you have additional packages with default statistics you have to restore the stats xml files with the suffix *.installed to /opt/otrs/var/stats.

section.title: Set file permissions
section.para: Please execute the following command as root user to set the file and directory permissions for OTRS:
It will try to detect the correct user and group settings needed for your setup.

section.title: Step 3.2: With the RPM:
section.para: In this case the RPM update automatically restores the old configuration files and sets file permissions.

section.title: Step 4: Run the migration script
section.para: This script will perform many checks on your system and give you advice on how to install missing Perl modules etc., if that is required. If all checks succeeded, the neccessary migration steps will be performed. Please also run this script in case of patch level updates.

note.para: The migration script will ask you to set a time zone for OTRS if needed. It is very important that you set the correct time zone (OTRSTimeZone) for data storage and keep it, otherwise date and time of data added after the upgrade (tickets, articles, etc.) will be stored with a different time zone than your pre-existing data, leading to inconsistent output.

For new systems, using UTC is recommended, as users can have different personal time zones for working with the OTRS application. For existing, migrated systems, a different OTRSTimeZone should be used if the underlying operating system is not configured to UTC or if OTRS previously used a time offset.

warning.para: Do not continue the upgrading process if this script did not work properly for you. Otherwise malfunction or data loss may occur.

section.title: Step 5: Restart your services
section.para: This will depend on your service configuration, here is an example:

para.screen: root> /etc/init.d/apache start root> /etc/init.d/postfix start root> /etc/init.d/cron start

section.para: Now you can log into your system. Please note that the OTRS Daemon is started only in a later step.

section.title: Step 6: Check installed packages
section.para: The OTRS 5 packages are NOT compatible with OTRS 6 and have to be updated.

section.title: Step 7: Start the OTRS Daemon and cron job
section.para: The OTRS daemon is responsible for handling any asynchronous and recurring tasks in OTRS. The daemon and its keepalive cron job must be started as the otrs user.

section.title: Step 8: Update system registration (optional)
section.para: If the system is already registered with OTRS Group, it is strongly recommended to update the registration information at this time. This will update the registered version of the system (among other changes) in the OTRS Group records, to help with solving issues that could potentially be caused by the upgrade.

If you don't update the registration information manually, it will be done automatically on a regular basis, but this could happen some hours or days later. During this period it might be possible to get wrong information from cloud services like the OTRS Business Solutionâ„¢ availability check.

para.screen: otrs> cd /opt/otrs/ otrs> bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Registration::UpdateSend --force otrs> bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Cache::Delete
